content.text: is designed to process original meter bills for a utility company. It involves inserting and updating records in the
tables based on data from the

table. The procedure checks if the current billing period has been processed and, if not, performs a series of insertions and updates to reflect the original and adjusted billing data. It also updates the status of processed records to prevent reprocessing.
The complexity of this stored procedure is high due to the following reasons:
It involves multiple table joins and conditional logic.
It performs several insert and update operations across different tables.
It uses dynamic data retrieval and manipulation based on the current billing period.
It includes error handling and transaction management, although not explicitly shown in the provided code.
: This parameter is intended to capture the ID of the user executing the procedure, although it is not actively used in the current implementation.
: This output parameter is meant to return the execution status of the procedure, indicating success or failure.
: The procedure begins by declaring and initializing several variables that will be used throughout the process, including counters and flags for billing periods and transaction control.
: It calculates the number of original bills that need processing by querying the
table, filtered by the current processing period and utility company ID.
: It checks how many original bills have already been processed by querying the
: If no original bills have been processed for the current period, it proceeds with the following steps:
, ensuring that only unprocessed records are considered.
table to mark records as processed and link them to the newly inserted records.
to control whether the transaction should be committed, although explicit transaction control statements (BEGIN TRANSACTION, COMMIT, ROLLBACK) are not shown.
: The procedure is designed to set the
output parameter to indicate the success or failure of the operation, although this logic is not explicitly detailed in the provided code.
: Ensure that the tables involved in joins and where clauses are properly indexed to optimize query performance.
: If the number of records is large, consider processing in batches to avoid locking and performance degradation.
: Implement explicit transaction control to ensure data integrity and manage potential rollbacks in case of errors.
: Without explicit transaction management, there is a risk of data inconsistency if multiple instances of the procedure run concurrently.
: The procedure lacks explicit error handling mechanisms, which could lead to unhandled exceptions and partial data processing.
: As the volume of data grows, the performance of the procedure may degrade if not optimized with appropriate indexing and query tuning.
), which reduces flexibility and requires code changes for different utility companies.

/*****************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************/
/*                                                                                                                                                                                                   */
/*****************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************/
-- Stored Procedure

CREATE PROCEDURE [Nypa].[usp_ProcessMeterBillingOriginalBills] @AuthenticatedUserID int , @StatusCode int  OUTPUT   

 AS --**************************************************************************************
--* Name:         
--*
--* Description:  Process Original Meter bills.
--*               
--* Exec:         usp_ProcessMeterBillingOriginalBills
--*
--* Parameter(s):         
--*								AuthenticatedUserID int, 
--*								CurrentBillingPeriod varchar(6),
--*								UtilityCompanySeqid int      - The sequence id of the Utility Companyto be processed
--*								StatusCode  int output       -  Execution Return Status 
--*
--*
--* Database:     OEC
--*
--* Return:	    0 Success
--*                   9 Failure
--*
--* AUTHOR:       Peter Heller (PAH)
--* Created On:   10/26/2005
--**************************************************************************************
--* Date         Tech Description of Change
--* ---------- ----  -------------------------------------------------------------
--* 03/16/2015 PAH  Added AMRindicator to MeterBillingElectric
--* 11/20/2006 PAH  Revised to 
--* 03/27/2006 PAH  Revised to 
--* 10/26/2005 PAH  First Version  
--* 12/20/2018 VY   Modified for UniqueAccountSeqID and UniqueMeterSeqID
--***************************************************************************************
Begin 
--************************************************************************************** 
--Declare Variables                                            
--**************************************************************************************
declare @IsCurrentBillingPeriod  int
declare @BillingPeriodMismatch  int
declare @HasCurrentBillingPeriodBeenProcessed  int
declare @OrginalBillsZeroProcessed  int
declare @NumberOfOrginalBills  int
declare @NumberOfOrginalBillsProcessed  int
declare @ProcessingCurrentBillingPeriod  int
declare @MeterBillingCount  int
declare @MeterBillingElectricCount  int
declare @UploadNYPAMeterBillingTemporary  int
declare @UtilityCompanySeqid int
--
declare @No  varchar(1)
declare @Yes  varchar(1)
declare @CurrentBillingPeriod varchar(6)
--
--
DECLARE @errCurrentAccountNumber NVARCHAR(15)
DECLARE @errOriginalAccountNumber NVARCHAR(15)
DECLARE @errCurrentMeterNumber NVARCHAR(12)
DECLARE @errOriginalMeterNumber NVARCHAR(12)
--
DECLARE @ExchangeErrorMessage NVARCHAR(4000);
DECLARE @ErrorMessage NVARCHAR(4000);
DECLARE @ErrorSeverity INT;
DECLARE @ErrorState INT;
DECLARE @ErrorNumber INT;
DECLARE @ErrorLine INT;
DECLARE @ErrorProcedure NVARCHAR(126);
--
declare @CommitTransaction varchar(1)  
--
declare @MeterBillingInsertCount int
declare @MeterBillingElectricInsertCount int
declare @MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricUpdateCount int
--
--**************************************************************************************  
--SET DEFAULTS                                                  
--**************************************************************************************
set @BillingPeriodMismatch = 0
set @OrginalBillsZeroProcessed = 0
set @ProcessingCurrentBillingPeriod = 0
set @No = 'N'
set @Yes = 'Y'
set @UtilityCompanySeqid = 7
--
--************************************************************************************** 
--	Main Processing
--**************************************************************************************
--
--	Check Whether it is the current billing and that the adjustments have not been already processed
--
--	remove AND Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod
--  add and (Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AdjustedMeterBilling IS null)  pah 4/29/2009
--
select	@NumberOfOrginalBills = COUNT(*)
FROM 
		Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric INNER JOIN
		Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame ON Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod AND 
		Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod
WHERE 
		(Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y') AND 
		(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid = 7)
--
print '@NumberOfOrginalBills: '+str(@NumberOfOrginalBills)
--
select	@NumberOfOrginalBillsProcessed  = COUNT(*) 
FROM 
		Billing.MeterBilling INNER JOIN
		Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame ON Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod AND 
		Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod
WHERE    
		(Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriod = Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriodRevision) and
		(Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y') AND 
		(Billing.MeterBilling.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid = 7)
--
print '@NumberOfOrginalBillsProcessed: '+str(@NumberOfOrginalBillsProcessed)
--
--  Determine that you have not processed the current billing period original bills
--

If (@NumberOfOrginalBillsProcessed = @OrginalBillsZeroProcessed)
   Begin

		set @CommitTransaction = 'Y'
		--
		SELECT @CurrentBillingPeriod = BillingPeriod FROM Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame WHERE (Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y')
		--
		--     Make sure that current billing period has not been processed and the count is less
		--     than one (1).   AccountName,AccountAddress,MeterLocation
		--
		--
		-- Insert the orginal and back bills where the UploadNYPAAccountBilling.RevisedBillingPeriod is used for all inserts.
		-- The inclusion of the back bills forces the use of the RevisedBillingPeriod for the BillingPeriod.  
		--
		INSERT INTO Billing.MeterBilling
	            (UniqueAccountSeqID, UniqueMeterSeqID, /* added on 12/20/2018 */
				AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid, UploadFileSeqid, OriginalAccountNumber, OriginalMeterNumber, BillingPeriod, BillingPeriodRevision, 
				NextBillingPeriod, PreviousBillingPeriod, BillCreationDate, BillingAction, MeterBillingStatus, PreviousMeterBillingStatus, 
				MeterBillingStatusCodePeriod, EnergySource, ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod, SalesType, UtilityServiceAddress, MeterType, MeterDials, 
				MeterConstant, Tension, EstimatedReading, ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading,  ProductionAndDeliveryTariff, 
				BillingPeriodDays, FromDate, 
				ToDate, ToReadingDate, FromReadingDate, Consumption, Demand, InitialPostingDate, AdjustmentRecordSeqid,
				AuthenticatedUserID, DateAdded, LastUpdate,AccountUtilityCompanySeqid,IsTimeOfDayAccount,LastPeriodModified,
				BilledDemand,MeterLocation,IsSpannedPeriodBill,MeterReactivePowerEnergy,AMRIndicator)
		SELECT 		
		        Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.UniqueAccountSeqId, /* added on 12/20/2018 */
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.UniqueMeterSeqId,  /* added on 12/20/2018 */
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.UploadFileSeqidUniquelyGrouped, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.OriginalAccountNumber, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.OriginalMeterNumber, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision, --Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision, 
				dbo.CreateNextPeriod(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod, 'M'), 
				dbo.CreatePreviousPeriod(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod, 'M'), 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid,   --null, --BillCreationDate,
				'O', Billing.Meter.MeterStatus, Billing.Meter.MeterPreviousStatus, Billing.Meter.MeterStatusCodePeriod, 1, 'Y', Billing.Account.SalesType, 
				Billing.Account.UtilityServiceAddress, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.MeterType, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.NumberOfDials, Billing.Meter.MeterConstant, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.MeterTensionCode, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ESTOrACT, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ProductionAndDeliveryTariff, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodDays, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.FromDate, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ToDate, 
				dbo.DetermineMeterReadingDate(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ConsumptionToReadingDate, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.DemandToReadingDate),
				dbo.DetermineMeterReadingDate(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ConsumptionFromReadingDate, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.DemandFromReadingDate), dbo.SumConsumption(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.Consumption, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ConsumptionHoursOffPeak, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ConsumptionHoursShoulder), 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.Demand, GETDATE(), 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid, -- AdjustmentRecordSeqid
				1, --@AuthenticatedUserID, 
				GETDATE(), GETDATE(), 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.IsTimeOfDayAccount, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod,
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BilledDemand,
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.MeterLocation,Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.IsSpannedPeriodBill,
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.MeterReactivePowerEnergy,
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AMRIndicator
		FROM
					Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric INNER JOIN
					Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack ON 
					Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid = Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid INNER JOIN
					Billing.Account ON Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalAccountSeqid = Billing.Account.AccountSeqid INNER JOIN
					Billing.Meter ON Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalMeterSeqid = Billing.Meter.MeterSeqid
		WHERE 
					(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AdjustedMeterBilling IS NULL) AND 
					(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod) AND 
					(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod = 'N')
		--

		select @MeterBillingInsertCount =@@rowcount
		print '@MeterBillingInsertCount: '+str(@MeterBillingInsertCount)
		--
		-- Insert the orginal and back bills where the UploadNYPAAccountBilling.RevisedBillingPeriod is used for all inserts.
		-- The inclusion of the back bills forces the use of the RevisedBillingPeriod for the BillingPeriod.  
		--
		INSERT INTO Billing.MeterBillingElectric
		        (UniqueAccountSeqID, UniqueMeterSeqID, /* added on 12/20/2018 */
				MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricRowId, MeterBillingRowId, OriginalAccountNumber, 
				OriginalMeterNumber, BillingPeriod, BillingPeriodRevision, 
				MeterBillingRowState, 
				DemandReadingCode,
				ConsumptionReadingCode, ProductionAndDeliveryTariff, ReadingTypes, 
				MeterBillingTypeElectric, RecordTypeConsumption, RecordTypeDemand, 
				BillingPeriodDays, FromDate, ToDate, 
				ConstantMeterMultiplier, StreetLightingFacilityPoints, 
				Consumption, ConsumptionToReadingDate, ConsumptionFromReadingDate, ConsumptionToReading, 
				ConsumptionFromReading, ConsumptionHoursOffPeak, ConsumptionHoursShoulder, 
				Demand, DemandToReadingDate, DemandFromReadingDate,
				DemandToReading, DemandFromReading, DemandOffPeak, DemandShoulder, 
				RatchetDemand, RatchetDemandOffPeak, RatchetDemandShoulder, 
				AuthenticatedUserID, DateAdded, LastUpdate,UtilityCompanySeqid, IsTimeOfDayAccount, LastPeriodModified,
				MeterReactivePowerEnergy ,MeterReactivePowerFactor,ContractNumber,AMRIndicator)
		SELECT    
			    Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.UniqueAccountSeqId, /* added on 12/20/2018 */
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.UniqueMeterSeqId,  /* added on 12/20/2018 */    
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid, Billing.MeterBilling.MeterBillingSeqid, Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalAccountNumber, 
				Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalMeterNumber, Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriodRevision, Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriodRevision AS Expr1, 1 AS Expr2, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ReadingCodeDemand, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ReadingCodeConsumption, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ProductionAndDeliveryTariff, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ReadingTypes, 
				dbo.DetermineMeterBillingAdjustmentType(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.RecordTypeConsumption, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.RecordTypeDemand) AS Expr3, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.RecordTypeConsumption, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.RecordTypeDemand, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodDays, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.FromDate, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ToDate, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ConstantMeterMultiplier, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.StreetLightingFacilityPoints, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.Consumption, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ConsumptionToReadingDate, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ConsumptionFromReadingDate, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ConsumptionToReading, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ConsumptionFromReading, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ConsumptionHoursOffPeak, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ConsumptionHoursShoulder, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.Demand, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.DemandToReadingDate, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.DemandFromReadingDate, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.DemandToReading, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.DemandFromReading, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.DemandOffPeak, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.DemandShoulder, NULL AS Expr4, NULL AS Expr5, NULL AS Expr6, 1 AS Expr7, GETDATE() AS Expr8, GETDATE() AS Expr9, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.IsTimeOfDayAccount, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod, Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.MeterReactivePowerEnergy, 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.MeterReactivePowerFactor,
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ContractNumber,Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AMRIndicator
		FROM 
				Billing.MeterBilling INNER JOIN
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric ON Billing.MeterBilling.LastPeriodModified = Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod AND 
				Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
				Billing.MeterBilling.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid = Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid AND 
				Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
				Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalMeterNumber = Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.OriginalMeterNumber AND 
				Billing.MeterBilling.AdjustmentRecordSeqid = Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid
		WHERE    
				(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AdjustedMeterBillingElectric IS NULL) AND 
				(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod) AND 
				(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod = 'N')		
		--
		select @MeterBillingElectricInsertCount =@@rowcount
		print '@MeterBillingElectricInsertCount: '+str(@MeterBillingElectricInsertCount)
		--
		UPDATE  Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric
		SET              
				ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod = 'Y', 
				AdjustedMeterBilling = Billing.MeterBilling.MeterBillingSeqid, 
				AdjustedMeterBillingElectric = Billing.MeterBillingElectric.MeterBillingElectricSeqid
		FROM 
				Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame INNER JOIN
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric ON Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod = Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod INNER JOIN
				Billing.MeterBilling INNER JOIN
				Billing.MeterBillingElectric ON Billing.MeterBilling.MeterBillingSeqid = Billing.MeterBillingElectric.MeterBillingRowId ON 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid = Billing.MeterBillingElectric.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricRowId AND 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid = Billing.MeterBilling.AdjustmentRecordSeqid
		WHERE   
				(Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y') AND 
				(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AdjustedMeterBilling IS NULL) AND 
				(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentElectric.AdjustedMeterBillingElectric IS NULL)
		--
		--
		select @MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricUpdateCount =@@rowcount
		print '@MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricUpdateCount: '+str(@MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricUpdateCount)
   --
   End
--
End
